pageContent: The ACS National Prostate Cancer Detection Project was established in 1987 to demonstrate the feasibility of early detection as a cancer control strategy for prostate cancer. Ten years later, the compliance results suggest that early detection programs can achieve long-term participation in a healthy population.

metaData.source:
NCCN Guidelines Updates: Management of Prostate Cancer
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31117038/
